IQkYPNj7ZYneqMR3Oav_xg.text: My friends and I shared a Green tea Mille cake, Strawberry Shortcake, and Chocolate Arc-en-Ciel. The green tea flavor was lacking in the mille cake while the chocolate cake was rich in flavor. The strawberry shortcake had a nice balance in sweetness and texture. Probably had better cakes for the price but would recommend it if you haven't tried layered crepe-cakes before for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Bottom left- Chocolate Arc-en-Ciel. Bottom right- Green tea mille Cake. Top- Strawberry Shortcake

FISTAOUt4WcKEilq0N7O-w.text: Two floors for this shopfront was pretty amazing. But one of my friends who is also an architect said that they could use some of the spaces to expand their seating areas.Came here at 9.20pm and there were queues for both take away and dine in. Looking at the display cases, there was not much choices left. Decided to get Apple Galette as it is specially baked at the Orchard Central branch for take away. Service was extremely slow. Probably because it is closing time and people are trying to take away or get their bills. Even though it is a big space, there is only one person in charged of the cashier, one person in charged of cutting the cakes. While standing and waiting for my order to be served, besides the lack of staffs they have, I noticed that most of the customers were impatient to get their orders. The waiting time was pretty long - 20-25 minutes even though they just had to put my order in a box without any plastic covers like the ones they put on the cakes. Was pretty disappointed at the service as I experienced a much better service at the Marina Square branch.Besides that, people was not in order especially at the take away section. They had to cut off the queue as it was about to close and they only had a few baked goods choices left when customers suddenly poured in. Since this is the first review of this branch, I will give a starting of 4 stars hoping that there is a change in this store in the upcoming future. I definitely love the modern touch for the interior design but would be better if there are more seatings in the store.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

5OolWZdU4JTVw71VEyeRig.text: Not a big fan of crepe cake so went Feuille instead.  Taste is ok but nothing that will have me come back for more. We also had the signature crepe cake as well as the citron crepe cake, again it was just ok.  The ambience is good, service is good too.  But the coffee is terrible - luke warm and tasted worse than Starbucks.  Curiosity really killed the cat this time :)

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Damage
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Signature
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Citron MillenCreme

lmt7eeXlDW-aTMjH7WjVwg.text: Mille crepes are awesome but it's sad that their coffee are just normal brewed coffee without any specialty beans.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate mille crepe and gateau nuage - cinnamon kissed graham cracker crust with cheese cake filling

ZuOyt6nD3saIUly-_IvX-w.text: What's all the hype about?I've heard people talk about Lady M, but never had a chance to go in New York, so I was excited to see a few locations in Singapore. A friend was visiting Singapore, so we met up over dessert at Lady M. The two of us are San Francisco foodies, and I don't think either of us were impressed.Since it was our first time, we opted for slices of the signature Mille Crêpe cakes; one original and one chocolate. The reaction, "meh." The original was a bit too sweet and the chocolate one isn't firm enough to stand up--it fell apart after the first cut.And they don't have decaffeinated coffee or espresso.

WsJ_1bB2xG05KOnNmNWXhA.text: Too pricey for the quality. It wasn't amazing or bad, just average. Had the green tea crepe and the flourless chocolate cake which were both pretty alright, nothing special. Though the ambience of the place is great for having long conversations.

ebTqTpSWlxPHbSW6EjbP-w.text: Worst service ever. We were so thirsty waiting for our drinks we asked for water. We received luke warm water so we asked for ice. The servers blank expression was perplexing but there response was even worse. They said they do not have ice for the water. I explained I just ordered ice coffee and could they not just take that ice and put it in my water? They said no but advised that I could take the ice "out" of my coffee and put it in my water. Fail!

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Being completely innovative and finding a way to make ice water at a place that does not serve ice with there water.

-PhOhxikjkrTCIVnb_L3ag.text: This new Lady M outlet looks like a giant space ship that has landed on Orchard Road.  The high ceiling is indeed impressive, but beyond that I hardly seem to recognise the sleek and elegant patisserie that I first visited more than 10 years ago in upper east side.  Seating arrangements are funny and I am a bit blinded by all the spotlights and silver railings.  I guess Lady M has evolved into a different kind of creature in Singapore.  At least their cakes are still consistently good.  I also tried their salad this time - I had the salmon and pumpkin salad while my friend had the grilled chicken salad.  Unfortunately both are just ok, way too much dressing, next time I will just stick to cakes.  The green tea crepe cake was good as usual, that saved my evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Grilled chicken pinenuts pasta salad
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Smoked salmon and pumpkin salad
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. The new Lady M on Orchard

IrLzdq4oaq77K7d8R8bBKQ.text: Loved the green tea layer crepe cake! Wish I got the chocolate limited flavor but instead opted for banana which wasn't too great! Overall great!

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Green tea layer crepe

G8aE-Njy6mjY9sUY3nfyqw.text: The signature cake is nice and actually is better than other similar layered cakes. They do the layers even thinner with a subtle caramelized top. The banana cake was so so as I felt it was old. The crust and banana seemed aged. Possibly not a high turn around on that one. The espresso actually has potential. Tasted like it was extracted properly. BUT it came out cold. Cold not even luke warm. I guess do to the pre order process of the place. Oh that. We waited 30 minutes for a seat. The venue is charming but it designed not to hold many seats. End result? Line up for a seat. I still think for 8.50-9 for any cake is a pretty good deal based on the quality. Of course bearing you are willing to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Strawberry overload!
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

mLgdAho_eMOQzUGjhcsPqA.text: I brought my mom to celebrate her birthday in Lady M. Not too much ppl when we arrived. Green tea cake is that much sweet and my mom liked very much. We request a small candle and they help to delight it, which is very sweet.

dt3_7v0AwwG8ybNO-eiENw.text: The service is so bad, order took forever to serve our cakes. And it took over 15mins to get  our bill

Dtur90t99JU-R9OIm44G2A.text: Came in on a Friday afternoon after lunch for coffee and cake. We ordered the green tea Mille, chocolate ganache, and lemon tart. All were great, would come back just for those. We ordered two hot chocolates and a latte, but when the hot chocolates came, we noted that it was not hot! However, after talking to the waiter, he apologized for it and offered to take it off our bill. Service level here is better than expected, would definitely come back!

jEeWjxc7pTs1XdimZfabmw.text: Nevermind its long queue and its lousy service, this is how a lady make us lust over her! nevermind about its breakfast and side dishes...its Green Tea Mille Crêpes is so exquisite!! Not any cake shop/cafes that sell cakes can duplicate that for sure! the texture of the mille crepes burnt a memory into my mind and tongue, i love how this lady torture me by burning me!Any budding chef should start doing intern here to perfect their skills!To cure my craving, i m going to buy a whole cake soon!

kd7UfUjKtuIRabzRqR7mtQ.text: Great spot for watching the world go by. Crepe layers work well to make a wonderful cake. Can get crowded so go on a mid week afternoon if you can.

g_jGQ6WC6h2lhK05xL2xnw.text: 10 points for the interesting layout, 9 points for the cake (beautiful mille crepes, but it was a little too creamy with too little actual cake for my liking), none for the service.

9kQS0A-3ndoOYp265uT3cw.text: Never knew they have cakes big enough for 30 pax, check out the half sheet they make

HE-0CgJtkuB5tQHle6j7cw.text: Omg this place is terrible in its hygiene! I saw a cock roach here (and it is safe to assume there are another 50 of them if you see one!) I told the staff and looked like she's already aware of the bad environment here but was trying to act surprised...I'm personally a big lady M fan but this is certainly unacceptable. I don't think I'm coming back again, at least not in this location.

O-uAC9TuZRpgbEKHT6AF0A.text: I've been wanting to try Lady M forever and after walking around the mall for a while, Lady M was an enticing option for a quick break. This particular cafe was set on a slope and seats are on multiple levels like in a stadium.We were seated by the window and ordered one slice of green tea millecrepe cake to share. I love that the cake is essentially a work of art. Given the dozens of layers, it starts to fall apart as you cut into it (or maybe that's just me because I'm clumsy). The cake had the right amount of sweetness without being overpowering. $11 later, we were done with our short break and headed out again.

9Bq81xLfVL_VoxsNwyTNSA.text: The cake is one of the best in the world. However the place if you seat near the windows, and look outside, you will see the bottom and the frames of the windows are so dirty.  They should clean them up more often.

GsAiXDIDBLlvPX6e5elsTw.text: The cakes were delicious. The service was not that great. There were many vacant tables and several staff members. The staff members were up top talking and enjoying each others company.

0UCIQ5FaOM5jjzC00dH8_A.text: The interior of this place is absolutely stunning, reminiscent of a fantastical glass palace straight out of a Disney movie. Floor-to-ceiling windows stretch across an entire wall, offering an uninhibited view of the pedestrians bustling below. The other side is lined with mirrors, which adds to the illusion of vastness. Tables are lackadaisically scattered across the two floors, creating a pleasantly bizarre look. My company and I got a slice of the Signature, Matcha and Chocolate (~$9 per slice). Each individual crepe is thin as a tissue sheet and meshes well with the adjacent layers of flavored cream. I especially loved the signature slice: without any extra flavoring, one can easily taste the freshness of the cream. However, past the first few bites, the richness of the cream becomes apparent and overwhelms one's senses. The simplicity of the cake becomes its downfall: there is nothing to mitigate the overly-rich taste of dairy and unfortunately, this ends the dessert on a sour note. Service is sadly incongruous with the extravagant and upmarket facade. Wait staff are clearly untrained students who seem more inclined to fiddle with their phones or chit-chat with colleagues. To conclude, despite the desserts failing to live up to the hype and price, this beautiful establishment is undeniably one of the best places to chill at along orchard road.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. The crepe cake up close! Note how thin each individual crepe is.
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Signature, matcha, chocolate!

QtQBb9bi4GFKdC0ec7WhYQ.text: I've always wanted to go to a Lady M, but something always prevents me in the States.  So since we were just wandering around Orchard Road, pretty much doing nothing, sitting down at Lady M was perfect.  We ordered the Signature and Green tea mille crepes and some drinks.  The multi layer of crepes is definitely amazing.  While we weren't a big fan of the Signature since there seemed to be so much cream and overly sweet, we loved the Green tea one.  It wasn't too sweet, and the green tea flavor was delicious.The place was great for passing away the time by sitting at the windows people watching.  Great and friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Espresso with green tea mille crepes

RoCNqlNiFdwobwaN5AlAtg.text: It was newly opened in Shanghai and the queue line is always 200 meters long. Happy to enjoy Lady M this afternoon without waiting in Singapore. Signature Mille crepes is the best I've ever had. But coffee is a disaster. Maybe I shouldn't have ordered a coffee with such a girly name "Lady M iced coffee".

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

QlOUMjuVGm1-gb0iEXoOgw.text: My favourite millecrepe place! The savory brunch items were decent too until they were sadly discontinued. Get the original and green tea millecrepes. The rest I've tried (including the special earl grey and chestnut flavours) aren't as strongly flavored or delicious. This location can be quite echo-y though. Not recommended for people who have issues with loud noise.Also, you need to share your millecrepe with a friend. Otherwise, it will be too gelat (i.e. you will be too glutted to enjoy it)!

8pTv7Rg2s3dL5YymzdFRYQ.text: Passed by Lady M at Orchard Central one day. The place looked contemporary, sleek and definitely looked like a place I would want to try. Took a quick look at the menu outside, they had pictures with yummy cakes. Told my sis we should do brunch one day and suggested Lady M.One Sunday morning, we arrived at what looked like the main entrance on the first floor. Lady M is a two floors restaurant. We arrived there at 10.40am, only to realize the restaurant opened at 11am. Never mind, we girls could check out the Zara nearby. Of cos, my niece and nephew were unhappy or should I say bored? After many many minutes passed, it was 11am and we went back to the restaurant's entrance. The "Closed" sign was still there and the door locked. We waited and waited. It was almost 11.10am. My sis got her kids to go to the second floor and see if that door was opened. From what I read before that day, the second floor entrance was for patrons to purchase and pick up their pastries. My nephew got back to the first floor and told us the door on the second floor was opened. We took the elevator at the mall, to the 2nd floor and headed to the restaurant. There were already a few other patrons heading into the restaurant. The two staffs seemed lost and did not know what to do. People started flowing into the restaurant. The restaurant seemed understaffed.We chose the table we wanted to sit and soon one server gave us a few menus.We ordered a few pot pies and paninis and two slices of cakes - the original Mille Crêpe and Banana Mille Feuille.The Black Pepper Chicken pie which I ordered was really really good. The pie was golden brown and really crispy. There were chunks of chicken and mushrooms inside the pie. The pie is definitely an A+ pie. The pie came with coleslaw (with raisins, a first for me but the combination was spot on) and some seaweed potato chips. Mille Crêpe - Very very nice. However, I could see why some yelpers complained the cake fell apart after some time. The cake really needs to be refrigerated and not sit out for too long. Best to be consumed in the restaurant.Banana Mille Feuille - Disappointing. The taste was good but there was way too much cream. There was more cream than the pastry. Like 90-10. I can make a better Mille Feuille.The Banana Mille Feuille was not what caused this two stars review. In fact, it was the pies and pastry that helped Lady M earned these two stars reviews from me. It was not even due to the alright service from the staffs or the fact that someone clearly forgot to open the door at the main entrance. What I could not get over was the amount of filth on the floor at the restaurant. See pictures. Doesn't anybody clean the floor before the restaurant opens every day? This is a restaurant for goodness sake. I felt the place lacks of basic restaurant hygiene. If no one cleans the floor, I wonder what it was like inside the kitchen :(Without the food and pastries, I am sure I will give this place only a one star (for the decor).

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Yummy Black Pepper Chicken Pot Pie
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Banana Mille Feuille
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Original Mille Crepe

PGNo4HMF7mxlHnPydGFlkg.text: The design of the place is very nice. You can sit at tables overseeing Orchard road.But the cholocate éclair was a big disappointment: super hard chocolate shell, tasteless filling. The chocolate millecrepe was better. But in my opinion, it's a boring dish. I have eaten far better chocolate than that.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

tOwRt9eZHPlpsq98Fmgl6g.text: I went to orchard branch 2 times. The environment and the cake was nice. But the staff service was pool.  When I came to the front of shop nobody bring us to inside and entertain us. Hope the service can be improve. I really like the cake and the environment there. But the service was disappointed.

J_Xz_WzcadrUEZnzsTDI8w.text: I have tried the cakes at all three Lady M outlets in Singapore and while this looks to be the biggest and airiest outlet, the mille crepe did not hold up as a takeaway. It went splat when I cut it with a fork, with the filling oozing out and the layered crepes flattening into a mess. So maybe it will be better to have it in store, or put it in the fridge if you buy it to go. I had mine about 30 minutes after purchase. I did not think it will require refrigeration as I was going to have it within an hour. The place was fairly big and encompassed two levels. Go directly to level 2 for take out as the cakes and cashier are on that level.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate Mille crepe and iced grey tea.
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Melted cream in under 2 hours in air conditioned room.
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Signature Mille crepes. $8.50 + tax

0ek6URpSNSj6mYBqrwyyOw.text: We had the Checkers and Lady M Signature Mille Crêpes. Nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

aOz7KTlFOGjpmLjqMxr5rg.text: The first time my friends and I wanted to eat here, the queue was too long. The 2nd time, I bought a few slices to take home. Not bad, the cakes were delicious. Finally, last weekend, I had a chance to get the full experience.It was Sunday at 8:30 pm. Got in through the ground floor, up through the staircase, saw a staff member (female) who told us to queue outside. On the way out, another staff (male) saw us and said "thank you for coming". He thought we had already finished eating.  Got to the queue and found no one there, waited patiently. In a short while the male staff came to usher us inside. On the way to our table, we bumped into another group coming up the staircase, looking for a table. While the male staff brought us to our table, the female staff took the other group to another table, without asking them to join the queue (there were a couple of people behind us). The table assigned to us was on the side of the staircase. It was difficult to get on the bench, and on the other side were high bar stools. Not easy for my elderly father, so we immediately requested a different table. I called the female staff 's attention, this was just after she had brought the other group to their table. I asked for another table and told her that the other group had cut the queue. She did not seem to realize that. We ordered a banana crepe and a chocolate ganache. Both took more than 15 minutes to arrive. They tasted ok, though I felt cheated because the banana crepe was mostly cream, with a few banana chunks. The chocolate ganache was rich and tasty, not too sweet.Overall, I think this place is just over hyped. The staff are friendly and helpful but the physical structure, with staircase and 2 entrances, do not help them at all. If I were the manager, I would strictly use the ground floor for exit only, to avoid confusion. The cakes are delicious, but not worth $9 for a slice.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

KLfLr26j3c2DlmC29L1XLw.text: Over rated. Over priced. Their Millie crepe was nice... But that was about it. It is about $9 per slice so I Guess I expected some wow factor. I was disappointed. I went on a weekday evening at about 845pm, near enough to closing time and there was still a queue. Waited not that Long, went in and noticed how big the place was. There were tables but i Guess they were understaffed. After they took our order (3 coffees, one water, two slices of cake) it took over 15mins to arrive. My Friend notice that that person slicing the cakes were so inexperienced that cakes that were being sliced were uneven and somewhat not that appetising. So the cake itself. Multi layered as it is supposed to be, nice texture and creamy and sweet cream filled between each layer. We had the chocolate and their signature. Preferred their signature one. The chocolate one was rather hard and each layer was sort of mushed together by the layering of the cream which is a bit too intense. Anyways, for our order, bill came up to about $40. Don't know what the hoo ha is all about, Glad that I tried it, won't go back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore

x68Z9g7TvqmE613dlPe97g.text: I'm in a dilemma to give this place a 2 or 3 stars. Food is not bad, but......Popped by for desserts after dinner with friends at around 9.30pm, and it's my first try at Lady M which I told my friend if green tea mille crepe is sold out I'll prolly not get anything. We just wanted a "quickie" and head home to rest since we are all working early the next day.We were joining the queue while we spied with our little eyes that there are many available seats. Me being me, walked straight to the service crew and asked if we could take their big table seating outside the cafe. So yes, we beat the queue and took our seat.The cafe was fully packed, so I went ahead to queue for take away in hope to ease the waiting time. I was standing there for a good 20 minutes before anyone spoke to me. A GOOD 20 MINUTES FOR TAKE AWAY. There was only 1 customer in front of me at the cashier. Entire service crew based on my observation include, 1 cashier, 1 lady inside the crepe area extremely busy cutting the crepe without stopping, 1 service crew whom I observed her job is to fold up the boxes and pack the crepe if there is any takeaway (by the way this crew has an issue if this is her only job scope), 1 service crew inside the kitchen, and 2 waiters, 1 to serve the dine-in and 1 to seat the customers.I was standing in a very awkward position in the line. There is an open service window for the servers to collect the mille crepe to serve dine-in, which intercepts with the cashier. So the waiter walked to and fro in front of me while waiting for this lady at the cashier ordering The good 20 mins allow me to observe how the entire team work and failed at their service. I think service could definitely been stepped up and better manage, to ease the queue into the cafe, to acknowledge customers' presence for take away, to fully utilize their existing staff strength, to better manage their cake distribution, ETC. Too many loopholes.I was really losing my patience since my friends and I were really tired and almost left for the day, the lady in front of me finally finished her orders! I jumped straight to my orders, when the cashier suddenly stopped me and carried out his SOP of telling me what are the items that ran out of orders. Actually I really can already see from my queue FOR THE PAST 20 MINS and have back up plans for orders that ran out, so I thought his explanation was really unnecessary and probably that explains why each order took so long. I snapped, but the cashier handled "this nasty customer" well. He lost a little patience too, but eventually tried his best to cool me down and returned wrong change.Eventually, I settled for a green tea mille crepe and a banana mille feulle for 4 to share. Both tasted really good, and ended my night on a sweet note. I like the creamy fillings of the green tea mille crepe that is generous yet not greasy, and the chunk of banana in the mille feulle (a little too much cream for this though). It's well balanced on the flavors!We finished, pack and go within 20 mins. It's not worth the wait for these mille crepes, and yes I will return only if there is no queue at all, be it take away or dine in.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. The remaining available after 9.30pm on Sunday!
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Green tea in front, and banana behind

bHJazCTiOGfA63RvM3wFZg.text: I ordered long black and miles crepes chocolate. The coffee was so-so, but the miles crepes was good. Nothing really special but the ambience was great with full view of Orchard road. The service was nice and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Mile creepe chocolate
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Ice coffee
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Long black

4ZNlZ_ev-5f9W9t16FfSng.text: Terrible. The tart au citron's crust was rancid, and the pot of English Breakfast was stained. And the kicker? The ice cappuccino ordered came hot and when asked, the server came with a glass of ice and said he was told to do so. Like, what? I don't get the hype and the queues. The cakes are quite normal, and you'd easily get places that aren't understaffed elsewhere with food served in under the 36mins we waited. Sanitary conditions leave room for much improvement, and the place had better step up its game before it gains some sort of food poisoning fame (hey it rhymes!).

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Dirty pot
Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore. Dirty pot

ZFwlFmzT9X5Tq9yNy5Jyrw.text: Came here on a weekday evening to see what the fuss was about.PROS * didn't have to wait (I've seen some pretty horrific lines)* Spacious and pretty interior* good variety of cakes offered CONS* for the price ($16), I could have had a better cake and coffee* the place seems kind of pretentious. People sneaking glances at others and giving off a general cold vibe.* Mille crepe cake was good, but not amazeballsWouldn't come back unless my arm was twisted to. The chocolate Mille crepe cake is more or less the same as the one served at Awfully Chocolate.

photos.caption: Photo of Lady M - Singapore, Singapore
